snippet: Studies have found that the recommended protocol of injectible antibiotics and hospitalization are hard for many poor people to carry out.
abstract: Studies published in journals The Lancet and Lancet Global Health find that giving oral antibiotics to newborns in danger of contracting pneumonia, sepsis or meningitis could save lives of 630,000 infants worldwide each year; protocol is easier to follow than previous World Health Organization recommendation of injected antibiotics.
lead_paragraph: Studies have found that the recommended protocol of injectible antibiotics and hospitalization are hard for many poor people to carry out.

headline.print_headline: Oral Antibiotics Are Found to Save More Infant Lives
